definition: in picturesque disorder (idiom); irregular arrangement with charming effect
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
surname Cuo
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey
(bound form) fine/delicate

sentences.english: The house is built on mountains, and in accordance with the level terrain formed a patchwork pattern.
sentences.chinese: 小屋依山而建，并依地势高低形成了错落有致的格局。
一个幻想的无缝错落有致。

sentences.english: The kitchen was counterchanged so there would be more space.
sentences.chinese: 厨房被弄成错落有致，所以会有更多的空间。

sentences.english: Of furniture decorate should size look line, on any account is conterminous , strewn at random have send.
sentences.chinese: 家具的布置应该大小相衬，高低相接，错落有致。

sentences.english: Amazing patchwork decorates this fantastic long sleeve jacket.
sentences.chinese: 惊人的错落有致，装饰这个奇妙的长袖外套。

sentences.english: Moderate the overall arrangement of patchwork gap width.
sentences.chinese: 整体排列错落有致缝隙宽窄适中。

uneven and jumbled (idiom); irregular and disorderly/in a tangled mess
to set each other off nicely
row upon row
hidden from view/alternately hidden and visible/setting off each other
trees/greenery
pavilions and kiosks (in Chinese gardens)
interesting and appealing (of old locations, objects etc)
scattered about like stars in the sky or chess pieces on a board (idiom); spread all over the place
high and low/uneven (in height)/uneven (of ground)
mountains on one side and water on the other
richly ornamented (building)
layer upon layer/tiered
verdant and lush (idiom)
cottage
